medical_history.chief_complaint: Frequent vomiting and aspiration observed during oral feeding in a newborn.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began during oral feeding, with vomiting improving after the introduction of nasoduodenal tube feeding; however, aspiration pneumonia still occurred. The patient underwent resection of the gastric tumor at 93 days of age and had a laryngoscopic repair of the laryngotracheoesophageal cleft at 198 days of age, which successfully prevented further aspiration pneumonia.
